sentences.english: Observing an anti-crime operation in Yau Tsim Police District.
sentences.chinese: 观察油尖警区的反罪案行动。

sentences.english: Observing the crowd management operation of Halloween in Central Police District.
sentences.chinese: 观察中区警区万圣节的人群管理行动。

sentences.english: The East China Sea Fleet with the PLA Navy held a ceremony at the pier to welcome the RSS Steadfast.
sentences.chinese: 中国海军东海舰队某水警区在码头举行了欢迎仪式。

sentences.english: He said some officers from Mong Kok police station are also being questioned.
sentences.chinese: 旺角警区部分警务人员亦被查问。

definition: police station (abbr. for 警察署[jing3 cha2 shu3])
police department/police station/abbr. of 警察局
special duty (e.g. extra security or traffic control on special occasions)/person on special duty
police classification/subdivision of policing activities (traffic, border guard, criminal etc)
to search for and seize (criminals, smuggled goods etc)
mounted police detachment (on horse or motorbike)
